column1: ## Some sentences for testing (all lowercase no punctuation ##
the nineteenth century dislike of realism is the rage of Caliban seeing his own face in a glass
men and women who work as slaves against themselves disguise their own human thought and judgement
god is dead said zarathustra and we have killed him how shall we comfort ourselves the murderers of all murderers
i am left in an utter juxtaposition of arbitrage against men who defy their own livelihoods
ive been cheated by you since i dont know when so i made up my mind it must come to an end look at me now will i ever learn i dont know how but i suddenly lose control theres a fire within my soul
